page_content:
![](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/_assets/3137b1a864c689786cac76b3def62dd1/Assets/img/default-banner.jpg)

# Giving away or donating a vehicle

If you wish to give a vehicle to a family member, a friend, a business or an organization, you must transfer the vehicle at an SAAQ service outlet. Conditions apply.

## Before going to an SAAQ service outlet

Call [Revenu Québec⁠ ⁠](https://www.revenuquebec.ca/en/contact-us/) if the person to whom you are giving the vehicle has no family relationship with you or you are giving the vehicle to a business or an organization.

## Transferring a vehicle is not possible if...

Any of the people involved have an unpaid fine in their driving record.

## Giving a vehicle to a member of your family

Go to one of our [service outlets](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/find-service-outlet) with the family member to whom you are giving the vehicle to transfer the vehicle and prove your family relationship.

You will have to complete the [Declaration of a Transaction Between Related Individuals with Regard to a Road Vehicle⁠ ⁠](https://www.revenuquebec.ca/en/online-services/forms-and-publications/current-details/vd-80.1-v/) form.

We will send the form to Revenu Québec so that your family relationship can be recognized.

### Documents required by the SAAQ to transfer the vehicle

You must present:

page_content:
We will send the form to Revenu Québec so that your family relationship can be recognized.

### Documents required by the SAAQ to transfer the vehicle

You must present:

- your driver's licence or another official photo ID document
- a document proving the family relationship, such as:
- a birth certificate (the long-form certificate)
- a copy of the act of birth
- the original or a certified copy of a contract or certificate proving your marriage or civil union
- a driver's licence bearing the same address and same last name
- any other document indicated in the "General information" section of the [_Declaration of a Transaction Between Related Individuals with Regard to a Road Vehicle_⁠ ⁠](https://www.revenuquebec.ca/en/online-services/forms-and-publications/current-details/vd-80-1-v/).

#### If you are under age 18

You must also present the [Consent of a Person Having Parental Authority (PDF, 128.7 KB)⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/parental-authority-form.pdf) form completed by your father, mother or legal guardian.

#### If you do not have a driver's licence

[Call us](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/reach-us) to find out what documents you must bring with you when registering your vehicle.

###### If you cannot go in person

page_content:
[Call us](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/reach-us) to find out what documents you must bring with you when registering your vehicle.

###### If you cannot go in person

The person who goes to the service outlet for you must bring the original [Power of Attorney (PDF, 657.0 KB)⁠ ⁠](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/blob/saaq/documents/formulaires/power-attorney-form.pdf) form completed by you beforehand.

### Costs and payment

#### Payment options

At our service outlets, we accept payment:

- in cash
- by Interac (debit card)-not available at some service outlets
- by one or more [pre-authorized debits](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/online-services/citizens/payment-pre-authorized-debits) (a cheque specimen must be provided)
- by cheque or money order

**Payment by credit card is not accepted.**

#### Payment of the GST and QST

In most cases, no GST or QST is charged when you give a vehicle to a family member.

## Giving a vehicle to a friend, a business or an organization

If the vehicle is given to a business or an organization, you must present a contract or invoice showing that the vehicle is a gift and provide the new owner's name.

If the vehicle is given to a friend, a business or an organization, the new owner may be required to pay the QST when the vehicle is transferred. To determine if this is the case, call [Revenu Québec](https://www.revenuquebec.ca/en/contact-us/).

The QST is generally based on the current estimated value of the vehicle.

page_content:
The QST is generally based on the current estimated value of the vehicle.

### Donating your old vehicle to a charity

If your vehicle is no longer usable, you can [discard](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/storage-licensing-for-road-use-or-discarding/vehicle-discarding) it and donate it to a charity.

### Document required by the SAAQ to transfer the vehicle

You must present your driver's licence or another official photo ID document.

## Mandatory private insurance coverage

You must have a civil liability insurance policy contracted from a private insurer providing minimum coverage of $50,000. The minimum is $1 million if you are a carrier and $2 million if you haul hazardous materials.

If you are not insured and you are pulled over by the police or involved in a traffic accident that causes more than $500 in damage to the property of another party:

- your driver's licence or your right to obtain one could be suspended
- all of your vehicles may be prohibited from being put into operation
- you will be fined an amount that varies depending on the type of vehicle

Last update: April 4, 2025

page_content:
## Safety first, on the road and online

We are committed to protecting your personal information and privacy. That's why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent. By continuing to browse without modifying your preferences, you accept the use of cookies.
